Class BitState

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.BitSet

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Node

    public class BitState
extends BitVector
    This class implements a logical state.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • BitState

        public BitState(BitExp exp)
         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates a new state from a specified BitExp.
        Parameters:
        exp - the BitExp that represents the logical state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if exp == null.

      • BitState

        public BitState(BitState state)
         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates a new state from an other state. This constructor is the copy constructor.
        Parameters:
        state - the other state to copy.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if state == null.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public final void apply(BitExp exp)
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Applies a specified BitExp to this state. In other word, the positive facts of the specified expression are added to this state and the negative ones are delete.
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to apply.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if exp == null.

      • satisfy

        public final boolean satisfy(BitExp exp)
                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns true if this state satisfy a specified expression.
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if this state satisfy a specified expression; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if exp == null.
